document_data.name: Aznar Thrul
document_data.refs3e: <ref group="note">On page 278 of the ''[[Forgotten Realms Campaign Setting 3rd edition]]'', Aznar is quoted as being [[chaotic evil]], but in a later book, ''[[Unapproachable East (sourcebook)|Unapproachable East]]'', page 168, he is [[lawful evil]]. It also changes two of his [[archmage]] levels to epic wizard levels.
document_data.text: Ten years ago, I brought an end to the Salamander War and order to the Priador, which replaced Bezantur as the southwestern tharch of Thay. In the absence of others... I became tharchion of the Priador and ruled it from Bezantur, but I was already a zulkir...
document_data.mainbody:
During the [[Salamander War]], Thrul bargained with [[Kossuth]], god of fire, to aid the Red Wizards. Their victory led to the capture of the Priador and the appointing of Thrul as its tharchion. This led to a close alliance between Thrul and [[Mythalanir]], high priest of Kossuth's [[Flaming Brazier]] temple.

Aznar was credited with rediscovering the ancient [[Mulhorand]]i secrets for creating [[gemstone golem]]s in [[1368 DR]], and set about building an army with which to conquer [[Rashemen]]. However, he underestimated how difficult it was to control these constructs. By [[1372 DR]], they were largely no longer under his control, and had spread out across the continent. His personal army also included the [[Sisters of Cyric]], a regiment of [[Cyricist]] [[priestess]]es who rode into battle on [[black unicorn]]s.

In the wake of becoming the tharchion of Priador, Aznar Thrul captured the former tharchion [[Mari Agneh]] and kept her as his slave and sexual play-thing. In [[1375 DR]], Mari was transformed by the [[blood fiend]] [[Tsagoth]] into his likeness and finally killed Thrul.

Aznar Thrul's position as Zulkir of [[Evocation]] remained filled for a time.
document_data.Personality: An exceedingly cruel and evil man, he was the greatest rival of the [[lich]] [[Szass Tam]], [[Zulkir]] of [[Necromancy]].
document_data.Relationships:
Thrul was originally trained in [[Magic|the Art]] at [[Blackstaff Tower]] by [[Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun]]. By the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]], he had his own apprentice: [[Mantorra Hennaflame]].

[[Ibbalar Thrul]], a Red Mage of Thay and one of the apprentices of [[Halaster Blackcloak]] from mid-14{{th}} century DR, was likely Aznar's relative.
